Personal Information How to Reach Me Papers Doctoral Research: Interaction and Information Presentation in Augemented Reality My research is done within the context of the Computer Graphics Lab Research in Augmented Reality . Augmented reality is a form of virtual reality that uses see-through displays to enhance the world will computer generated material. More powerful, automated environment management techniques are required. We are building a testbed ( COTERIE ) for fast prototyping of distributed virtual environment systems that supports multiple simultaneous users interacting in environments with many heterogenous displays and input devices. The testbed is designed around a multi-threaded, modular, object oriented programming model and supports fully transparent distributed communications via both client-server and fully replicated distributed objects. By building applications as groups of cooperating threads, a single programming model can be used for both single and multiprocess programs. An important component of this testbed is a high-level, distribted graphics library. Finaly, we are building a number of applications using this testbed and environment management to both demonstrate their utility and point the way towards future research. Check back in early July. Proselytization I'm using Modula-3 for my research right now, because I believe it's the best language that I have available on all the architectures I need to use. I'm also using Obliq, an interpretted language built on top of Modula-3. An Obliq computation may involve multiple threads of control within an address space, multiple address spaces on a machine, heterogeneous machines over a local network, and multiple networks over the Internet. The distributed computation mechanism is based on Modula-3 Network Objects. bm@cs.columbia.edu
